title: VC Daily: Canada Continues Venture Growth
text:
Much of this venture value occurred in deals ranging from roughly US$4 million to about US$40 million, while 17 megadeals of more than roughly US$40 million accounted for 38% of total dollars invested in the year, according to the report.

A handful of U.S. venture firms contributed significant capital to these totals. For example, San Francisco-based Versant Ventures poured in $178 million over two deals. New York-based OrbiMed Advisors contributed $293 million over three deals. Ohio-based Drive Capital invested roughly $98 million over two deals.

And now on to the news...

Top News

Real-world growth. Rec Room Inc., a social-minded videogame platform, has garnered a valuation of $1.25 billion in a fundraising round that brought in $100 million in new capital, Matt Grossman reports for WSJ Pro. Sequoia Capital and Index Ventures led the investment, with participation from Madrona Venture Group. Like Roblox Corp ., a larger platform that went public earlier this month, Rec Room is popular primarily among young people. Users on both platforms can design games and virtual worlds where players can interact with each other's avatars.

Rec Room earns revenue from a "virtual economy," in which players pay real-world money for virtual currency that they can use on in-game purchases. Rec Room said that revenue grew more than sixfold year-over-year in 2020.

Investors at Sequoia and Index lauded the company's business model, but the easing of the coronavirus pandemic could present a challenge as a reopening economy brings people back to more traditional entertainment options.

Rec Room, founded in 2016, has now raised a total of $149 million.

Shipping Giants Team Up on Startup Deal

A handful of international shipping and logistics giants, including A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S , have teamed up with venture firm 8VC to invest in a startup that matches freight with trucks, WSJ Pro's Marc Vartabedian reports. The relatively small $10.5 million deal illustrates how legacy logistics behemoths are taking an increased interest in a crop of young startups that are aiming to disrupt the industry. Some are investing out of venture arms launched in the past several years that are meant to give the companies a toehold in emerging logistics technology.

Maersk's venture arm Maersk Growth, which began investing in 2018, co-led the financing round into Baton Trucking Inc. alongside 8VC. The venture divisions of truck-fleet operator Ryder System Inc. and Prologis Inc., which invests in logistics facilities, participated in the deal along with refrigerated-storage company Lineage Logistics LLC.

Securities-Trading App Robinhood Files for IPO

Robinhood Markets Inc ., the popular securities-trading app, filed paperwork with the Securities and Exchange Commission for what's sure to be one of the year's most eagerly awaited initial public offerings, WSJ reports. Robinhood announced the filing, which it made confidentially, in a statement Tuesday.

Industry News

SPACs

Velo3D Inc . is going public through a combination with the special-purpose acquisition company led by real-estate investor Barry Sternlicht , in a deal that values the 3D metal-printing company at about $1.6 billion, including debt. Campbell, Calif.-based Velo3D will get up to $345 million in proceeds from JAWS Spitfire Acquisition Corp .'s cash in trust and a $155 million private placement at $10 a share. Upon completion of the transaction, Velo3D will have about $470 million of cash, net of debt and assuming no redemptions are effected. The company has raised funding from investors including Bessemer Investment Partners, Playground, Khosla Ventures and Piva.

People

Fintech investor TTV Capital appointed Neil Kapur as partner. He joins the Los Angeles- and Atlanta-based firm from B Capital Group, where he led investments in fintech and insuretech. Earlier this month, TTV participated in a funding round for TaxBit Inc., a cryptocurrency tax and accounting automation software provider.

Cogito, which analyzes phone conversations and provides real-time behavioral guidance to help phone professionals deal with customers, named Doug Wendell as chief financial officer. He previously held the same position at Quick Base. Boston-based Cogito raised a $25 million investment in November from investors including Goldman Sachs Growth Equity and Salesforce Ventures .

Customer engagement startup Freshworks Inc ., appointed Stacey Epstein as chief marketing officer. She was most recently chief marketing and customer experience officer at ServiceMax Inc. San Mateo, Calif.-based Freshworks is backed by Sequoia Capital, CapitalG and Accel.

Exits

UiPath Inc ., an enterprise-software company that made a confidential filing to go public in December, acquired Cloud Elements, which helps developers integrate cloud services into their products. Terms weren't disclosed. Earlier this year, UiPath was valued at $35 billion after a $750 million Series F round co-led by existing investors Alkeon Capital and Coatue Management, with participation from Altimeter Capital, Dragoneer, IVP, Sequoia, Tiger Global and funds and accounts advised by T. Rowe Price Associates Inc . Cloud Elements was backed by investors including Mercato Partners , American Express Ventures, Grotech Ventures and Harbert Growth Partners.

Virtual-events startup Hopin Ltd. acquired video hosting provider Streamable and video technology company Jamm for an undisclosed sum. Earlier this month, Hopin raised a $400 million Series C round from Andreessen Horowitz , General Catalyst and IVP that valued the London-based company at $5.65 billion. Wilmington, Del.-based Streamable was backed by Great Oaks Venture Capital , Luminari Capital and Hive Ventures. Jamm counted Hummer Winblad Venture Partners as an investor.

Privacy, security and third-party risk technology platform OneTrust is making its second acquisition this month with an agreement to purchase Convercent, an enterprise ethics and compliance management software provider, for an undisclosed amount. OneTrust, based in Atlanta and London, raised a $300 million Series C round in December at a $5.1 billion valuation. TCV, Insight Partners and Coatue were the investors. Denver-based Convercent is backed by Sapphire Ventures , Tola Capital and Azure Capital Partners.

Advertisement

New Money

Dataminr , a New York-based artificial intelligence provider for event and risk detection, picked up a $475 million investment, giving the company a valuation of $4.1 billion. Investors included Lurra Capital, Eldridge, Valor Equity Partners , MSD Capital, Reinvent Capital, ArrowMark Partners , IVP, Eden Global and investment funds managed by Morgan Stanley Tactical Value.

Eat Just Inc ., a San Francisco-based producer of a plant-based egg substitute, secured $200 million in funding. Qatar Investment Authority led the round, which included support from Charlesbank Capital Partners and Vulcan Capital.

Orca Security, a Los Angeles- and Tel Aviv-based cloud security startup, scored a $210 million Series C round valuing the company at $1.2 billion. CapitalG and Redpoint Ventures led the investment, which included participation from GGV Capital and Iconiq Growth.

Aiven, a Helsinki-based cloud-data platform, raised a $100 million Series C round, bringing the company's valuation up to more than $800 million. Atomico led the funding, which included participation from new investors Salesforce Ventures and World Innovation, along with previous backers Earlybird Venture Capital and IVP.

Pacaso, a second home marketplace, snagged $75 million in growth funding at a valuation of $1 billion. Greycroft and Global Founders Capital led the round, and were joined by Acrew Diversify Capital Fund, First American Financial, Shea Ventures and others. Pacaso also hired Nina Tran as chief financial officer.

Freetrade, a U.K. trading platform, plans to raise more than $69 million in Series B funding led by Left Lane Capital, with additional support from L Catterton and Draper Esprit .

ActionIQ, a customer data platform based in New York and San Francisco, added $68 million in Series C funding, bringing the round total to $100 million. Investors in the round included March Capital Partners , Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz and FirstMark Capital . The initial tranche was raised in January 2020.

Lattice, a San Francisco-based employee performance management startup, fetched a $60 million Series E investment, giving the company a $1 billion valuation. Tiger Global Management led the round, with participation from Thrive Capital, Shasta Ventures , Founders Fund, Frontline Ventures, Fuel Capital, Khosla Ventures and others.

Meatable, a Dutch cultivated meat startup, closed a $47 million Series A round from investors including Section 32, DSM Venturing, BlueYard Capital, Agronomics and Humboldt.

Vórtx, a São Paulo-based infrastructure fintech for the financial market, grabbed $35 million in Series B financing led by FTV Capital .

Tylko, a Poland-based custom shelving startup, completed a €22 million ($26 million) Series C round of funding led by Pitango Ventures and Evli Growth Partners.

Roambee, a Santa Clara, Calif.-based supply chain visibility provider, secured more than $18 million in Series B1 funding led by Reefknot Investments.

Tech News

InteI plans to use more third-party chip-making partners starting in 2023.

Intel CEO presses turnaround effort with $20 billion investment plan

GameStop shares slump as pandemic forces changes

IronSource gets $11 billion valuation in SPAC merger, betting on ads in mobile games

TuSimple IPO filing shows self-driving trucks still a money-loser

Chinese tech faces new curbs on connecting banks and borrowers
